creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: grey and white bird standing on PR foot on the branch of a tree while looking back; branch of another tree at top
text: The subject of the hawk reflected the values of a warrior society. Yukinobu’s style closely adhered to that of his well-known older brother, Kano_ Motonobu (1476–1559), making this a perfect example of the early 16th-century Kano_ school of painting.
title: Hawk
